verses.kjv: Behold, the day of the LORD cometh, and thy spoil shall be divided in the midst of thee.
verses.ct: Pay attention — a day belonging to the LORD is coming when the plunder taken from you will be divided right in your midst.

verses.kjv: For I will gather all nations against Jerusalem to battle; and the city shall be taken, and the houses rifled, and the women ravished; and half of the city shall go forth into captivity, and the residue of the people shall not be cut off from the city.
verses.ct: I will bring all the nations together to attack Jerusalem. The city will be captured, the houses looted, and the women violated. Half the city will be dragged off into exile, but the rest of the people will not be removed from the city.

verses.kjv: Then shall the LORD go forth, and fight against those nations, as when he fought in the day of battle.
verses.ct: Then the LORD will go out and wage war against those nations, just as he fights on a day of battle.

verses.kjv: And his feet shall stand in that day upon the mount of Olives, which is before Jerusalem on the east, and the mount of Olives shall cleave in the midst thereof toward the east and toward the west, and there shall be a very great valley; and half of the mountain shall remove toward the north, and half of it toward the south.
verses.ct: On that day, his feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, which lies east of Jerusalem. The Mount of Olives will split in two from east to west, forming an enormous valley, with half the mountain shifting north and the other half shifting south.

verses.kjv: And ye shall flee to the valley of the mountains; for the valley of the mountains shall reach unto Azal: yea, ye shall flee, like as ye fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah: and the LORD my God shall come, and all the saints with thee.
verses.ct: You will escape through this mountain valley, because it will extend all the way to Azal. You will run just like you ran from the earthquake during the reign of King Uzziah of Judah. Then the LORD my God will arrive, and all the holy ones with him.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the light shall not be clear, nor dark:
verses.ct: On that day, there will be no light — the bright sources of light will fade away.

verses.kjv: But it shall be one day which shall be known to the LORD, not day, nor night: but it shall come to pass, that at evening time it shall be light.
verses.ct: It will be a unique day, known only to the LORD — neither daytime nor nighttime. Yet when evening comes, there will be light.

verses.kjv: And it shall be in that day, that living waters shall go out from Jerusalem; half of them toward the former sea, and half of them toward the hinder sea: in summer and in winter shall it be.
verses.ct: On that day, fresh flowing water will stream out from Jerusalem, half of it toward the eastern sea and half toward the western sea, flowing continuously in both summer and winter.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall be king over all the earth: in that day shall there be one LORD, and his name one.
verses.ct: The LORD will be king over the entire earth. On that day, the LORD will be the only one, and his name the only name.

verses.kjv: All the land shall be turned as a plain from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem: and it shall be lifted up, and inhabited in her place, from Benjamin’s gate unto the place of the first gate, unto the corner gate, and from the tower of Hananeel unto the king’s winepresses.
verses.ct: The whole land from Geba to Rimmon, south of Jerusalem, will be flattened into a plain. But Jerusalem will be raised up and will remain in its place, from the Gate of Benjamin to the site of the First Gate, all the way to the Corner Gate, and from the Tower of Hananeel to the royal winepresses.

verses.kjv: And men shall dwell in it, and there shall be no more utter destruction; but Jerusalem shall be safely inhabited.
verses.ct: People will live in it, and never again will it face total destruction. Jerusalem will be inhabited in safety.

verses.kjv: And this shall be the plague wherewith the LORD will smite all the people that have fought against Jerusalem; Their flesh shall consume away while they stand upon their feet, and their eyes shall consume away in their holes, and their tongue shall consume away in their mouth.
verses.ct: This is the plague the LORD will strike against all the peoples who attacked Jerusalem: their flesh will rot while they are still standing on their feet, their eyes will decay in their sockets, and their tongues will rot in their mouths.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that a great tumult from the LORD shall be among them; and they shall lay hold every one on the hand of his neighbour, and his hand shall rise up against the hand of his neighbour.
verses.ct: On that day, the LORD will throw them into massive panic. Each person will grab the hand of the one next to him, and they will turn on each other violently.

verses.kjv: And Judah also shall fight at Jerusalem; and the wealth of all the heathen round about shall be gathered together, gold, and silver, and apparel, in great abundance.
verses.ct: Judah too will fight at Jerusalem, and the wealth of all the surrounding nations will be collected — gold, silver, and clothing in enormous quantities.

verses.kjv: And so shall be the plague of the horse, of the mule, of the camel, and of the ass, and of all the beasts that shall be in these tents, as this plague.
verses.ct: A similar plague will also strike the horses, mules, camels, donkeys, and every other animal found in those camps.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that every one that is left of all the nations which came against Jerusalem shall even go up from year to year to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, and to keep the feast of tabernacles.
verses.ct: Then everyone who survives from all the nations that attacked Jerusalem will go up year after year to worship the King, the LORD of Hosts, and to celebrate the Festival of Shelters.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, that whoso will not come up of all the families of the earth unto Jerusalem to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, even upon them shall be no rain.
verses.ct: If any family on earth refuses to go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the LORD of Hosts, no rain will fall on their land.

verses.kjv: And if the family of Egypt go not up, and come not, that have no rain; there shall be the plague, wherewith the LORD will smite the heathen that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.
verses.ct: If the people of Egypt refuse to go up and participate, they will receive no rain either. The LORD will strike them with the same plague he sends on any nation that does not go up to celebrate the Festival of Shelters.

verses.kjv: This shall be the punishment of Egypt, and the punishment of all nations that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.
verses.ct: This will be the punishment for Egypt and for every nation that refuses to go up and celebrate the Festival of Shelters.

verses.kjv: In that day shall there be upon the bells of the horses, HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD; and the pots in the LORD’s house shall be like the bowls before the altar.
verses.ct: On that day, even the bells on the horses will be inscribed with 'HOLY TO THE LORD,' and the ordinary cooking pots in the LORD's house will be as sacred as the bowls used at the altar.

verses.kjv: Yea, every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah shall be holiness unto the LORD of hosts: and all they that sacrifice shall come and take of them, and seethe therein: and in that day there shall be no more the Canaanite in the house of the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: In fact, every pot in Jerusalem and Judah will be holy to the LORD of Hosts. Everyone who comes to offer sacrifices will take these pots and cook in them. On that day, there will no longer be any merchant in the house of the LORD of Hosts.
